meanings.definition: Not additive; not able to be added together.
meanings.sent1: The colors on the painting were nonadditive, creating a unique blend that couldn't be replicated.
meanings.sent2: The nonadditive ingredients in the recipe resulted in a flavor that was unlike anything I had tasted before.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces were nonadditive, refusing to fit together no matter how hard I tried.
meanings.sent4: Her nonadditive approach to problem-solving led to innovative solutions that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The nonadditive nature of the experiment produced unexpected results that challenged traditional theories.

meanings.definition: Having a property that is not the sum of the properties of its parts.
meanings.sent1: The sculpture had a nonadditive quality, where each individual piece contributed to a greater whole.
meanings.sent2: The nonadditive nature of the material made it ideal for creating structures that defied conventional design principles.
meanings.sent3: The nonadditive flavors in the dish danced on my taste buds, creating a delightful culinary experience.
meanings.sent4: Her nonadditive personality traits combined to form a truly unique and captivating individual.
meanings.sent5: The artist's use of nonadditive elements in the composition added depth and complexity to the artwork.
